result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Joseph Barnes

defendant.name: Barnes, Matthew Joseph
defendant.address: 7629 West Washington Street #4, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for Matthew Joseph Barnes.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 

DTC - PHASE ORIENTATION

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 1 point.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew J Barnes appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for Matthew J Barnes.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC - PHASE ORIENTATION

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant * points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich appeared by video for Matthew Joseph Barnes.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC - PHASE 

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 0 points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

TURN OVER TO JUSTICE POINT for placement of a residential bed. As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit. Court orders cash bond to be CONVERTED to $250 signature bond.

Defendant Matthew J Barnes in court, in custody.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for Matthew J Barnes.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1, 4, 5, and 6 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Counts 2, and 3: The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
DTC Contract (corrected), filed.
filed.
Drug Treatment Court Contract, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.
filed.

Defendant Matthew J Barnes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Matthew J Barnes.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense advises the Court the defendant may be accepted into drug treatment court and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court via Zoom, defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court that this case is eligible for drug treatment court, and is awaiting acceptance. Defense will inform the court of the case status at next hearing.
Court remains calendared in branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes not in court, in custody.   Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Pretrial  Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and global offer and seeking to resolve this case in drug treatment court and defendant has a tad evaluation schedule.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMW.

Defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a return on doctor's report. 
Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Court adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his defense. Court finds defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings.  
Defense advises the court there needs to be an initial appearance on this case. Initial appearance conducted. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney. Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 
Defense advises the court they need discovery and anticipate a global offer and request a pre-trial conference date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Defendant has pending matter scheduled on 4/11/2022 at 1:30pm, this case to follow.
Received and Forwarded.

Defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Matthew Joseph Barnes in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley , Branch 19.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
